DirectCollection.description: Did you collect the data from the individuals in question directly, or obtain it via third parties or other sources?

description: Participants were enrolled at specialty clinics and data was collected directly from them using standardized protocols.

CollectionNotification.description: Were the individuals in question notified about the data collection?

description: Participants were informed about the data collection and the study’s objectives through an IRB-approved consent process.

CollectionConsent.description: Did the individuals in question consent to the collection and use of their data?

description: All participants explicitly provided informed consent for the collection and use of their data for research.

ConsentRevocation.description: If consent was obtained, were the consenting individuals provided with a mechanism to revoke their consent?

description: Participants were informed they could withdraw or revoke consent at any time, in accordance with standard IRB protocols.

EthicalReview.description: Were any ethical review processes conducted (e.g., by an institutional review board)?

description: Data collection and sharing was approved by the University of South Florida IRB and submitted for review to the University of Toronto Research Ethics Board.

DataProtectionImpact.description: Has an analysis of the potential impact of the dataset and its use on data subjects been conducted?

description: A thorough ethical and data security assessment was performed to minimize risks associated with collecting and sharing voice and health data.

Deidentification.description: Is it possible to identify individuals (natural persons), either directly or indirectly …?

description: All HIPAA Safe Harbor identifiers were removed. Only derived spectrograms and features are released, reducing re-identification risk.

Confidentiality.description: Does the dataset contain data that might be considered confidential (e.g., doctor‐patient confidentiality)?

description: The dataset includes clinical and demographic data subject to confidentiality obligations. Appropriate safeguards have been implemented.

SensitiveElement.description: Does the dataset contain data that might be considered sensitive in any way (e.g., race, ethnicity, etc.)?

description: Demographic and clinical data in the dataset may include elements considered sensitive, such as race, ethnicity, or health conditions.

Subpopulation.description: Does the dataset identify any subpopulations (e.g., by age, gender)?

distribution: 306 participants across five sites in North America

RetentionLimits.description: If the dataset relates to people, are there applicable limits on the retention of the data …?

description: Data retention adheres to IRB and NIH guidelines. Long-term storage is permitted for approved research, with periodic ethical review.
